item.title: Isaiah 1
item.description: v1 The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem, in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.

item.title: Isaiah 2
item.description: v1 This is what Isaiah the son of Amoz saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem.

item.title: Isaiah 3
item.description: v1 For, behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, takes away from Jerusalem and from Judah supply and support, the whole supply of bread, and the whole supply of water;

item.title: Isaiah 4
item.description: v1 Seven women shall take hold of one man in that day, saying, “We will eat our own bread, and wear our own clothing.

item.title: Isaiah 5
item.description: v1 Let me sing for my well beloved a song of my beloved about his vineyard.

item.title: Isaiah 6
item.description: v1 In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple.

item.title: Isaiah 7
item.description: v1 In the days of Ahaz the son of Jotham, the son of Uzziah, king of Judah, Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah, king of Israel, went up to Jerusalem to war against it, but could not prevail against it.

item.title: Isaiah 8
item.description: v1 Yahweh said to me, “Take a large tablet, and write on it with a man’s pen, ‘For Maher Shalal Hash Baz’;

item.title: Isaiah 9
item.description: v1 But there shall be no more gloom for her who was in anguish.

item.title: Isaiah 10
item.description: v1 Woe to those who decree unrighteous decrees, and to the writers who write oppressive decrees;

item.title: Isaiah 11
item.description: v1 A shoot will come out of the stock of Jesse, and a branch out of his roots will bear fruit.

item.title: Isaiah 12
item.description: v1 In that day you will say, “I will give thanks to you, Yahweh; for though you were angry with me, your anger has turned away and you comfort me.

item.title: Isaiah 13
item.description: v1 The burden of Babylon, which Isaiah the son of Amoz saw.

item.title: Isaiah 14
item.description: v1 For Yahweh will have compassion on Jacob, and will yet choose Israel, and set them in their own land.

item.title: Isaiah 15
item.description: v1 The burden of Moab. For in a night, Ar of Moab is laid waste, and brought to nothing.

item.title: Isaiah 16
item.description: v1 Send the lambs for the ruler of the land from Selah to the wilderness, to the mountain of the daughter of Zion.

item.title: Isaiah 17
item.description: v1 The burden of Damascus. “Behold, Damascus is taken away from being a city, and it will be a ruinous heap.

item.title: Isaiah 18
item.description: v1 Ah, the land of the rustling of wings, which is beyond the rivers of Ethiopia;

item.title: Isaiah 19
item.description: v1 The burden of Egypt. “Behold, Yahweh rides on a swift cloud, and comes to Egypt.

item.title: Isaiah 20
item.description: v1 In the year that Tartan came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it;

item.title: Isaiah 21
item.description: v1 The burden of the wilderness of the sea. As whirlwinds in the South sweep through, it comes from the wilderness, from an awesome land.

item.title: Isaiah 22
item.description: v1 The burden of the valley of vision. What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops?

item.title: Isaiah 23
item.description: v1 The burden of Tyre. Howl, you ships of Tarshish! For it is laid waste, so that there is no house, no entering in.

item.title: Isaiah 24
item.description: v1 Behold, Yahweh makes the earth empty, makes it waste, turns it upside down, and scatters its inhabitants.

item.title: Isaiah 25
item.description: v1 Yahweh, you are my God. I will exalt you! I will praise your name, for you have done wonderful things, things planned long ago, in complete faithfulness and truth.

item.title: Isaiah 26
item.description: v1 In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: “We have a strong city.

item.title: Isaiah 27
item.description: v1 In that day, Yahweh with his hard and great and strong sword will punish leviathan, the fleeing serpent, and leviathan the twisted serpent; and he will kill the dragon that is in the sea.

item.title: Isaiah 28
item.description: v1 Woe to the crown of pride of the drunkards of Ephraim, and to the fading flower of his glorious beauty, which is on the head of the fertile valley of those who are overcome with wine!

item.title: Isaiah 29
item.description: v1 Woe to Ariel! Ariel, the city where David encamped! Add year to year; let the feasts come around;

item.title: Isaiah 30
item.description: v1 “Woe to the rebellious children”, says Yahweh, “who take counsel, but not from me; and who make an alliance, but not with my Spirit, that they may add sin to sin,

item.title: Isaiah 31
item.description: v1 Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help, and rely on horses, and trust in chariots because they are many, and in horsemen because they are very strong, but they don’t look to the Holy One of Israel, and they don’t seek Yahweh!

item.title: Isaiah 32
item.description: v1 Behold, a king shall reign in righteousness, and princes shall rule in justice.

item.title: Isaiah 33
item.description: v1 Woe to you who destroy, but you weren’t destroyed, and who betray, but nobody betrayed you!

item.title: Isaiah 34
item.description: v1 Come near, you nations, to hear! Listen, you peoples. Let the earth and all it contains hear, the world, and everything that comes from it.

item.title: Isaiah 35
item.description: v1 The wilderness and the dry land will be glad. The desert will rejoice and blossom like a rose.

item.title: Isaiah 36
item.description: v1 Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria attacked all of the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.

item.title: Isaiah 37
item.description: v1 When king Hezekiah heard it, he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into Yahweh’s house.

item.title: Isaiah 38
item.description: v1 In those days Hezekiah was sick and near death. Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him, and said to him, “Yahweh says, ‘Set your house in order, for you will die, and not live.

item.title: Isaiah 39
item.description: v1 At that time, Merodach Baladan the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present to Hezekiah; for he heard that he had been sick, and had recovered.

item.title: Isaiah 40
item.description: v1 “Comfort, comfort my people,” says your God. v2 “Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of Yahweh’s hand double for all her sins.

item.title: Isaiah 41
item.description: v1 “Keep silent before me, islands, and let the peoples renew their strength.

item.title: Isaiah 42
item.description: v1 “Behold, my servant, whom I uphold, my chosen, in whom my soul delights: I have put my Spirit on him.

item.title: Isaiah 43
item.description: v1 But now Yahweh who created you, Jacob, and he who formed you, Israel, says: “Don’t be afraid, for I have redeemed you.

item.title: Isaiah 44
item.description: v1 Yet listen now, Jacob my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen.

item.title: Isaiah 45
item.description: v1 Yahweh says to his anointed, to Cyrus, whose right hand I have held, to subdue nations before him, and strip kings of their armor; to open the doors before him, and the gates shall not be shut:

item.title: Isaiah 46
item.description: v1 Bel bows down. Nebo stoops. Their idols are carried by animals, and on the livestock.

item.title: Isaiah 47
item.description: v1 “Come down and sit in the dust, virgin daughter of Babylon.

item.title: Isaiah 48
item.description: v1 “Hear this, house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel, and have come out of the waters of Judah.

item.title: Isaiah 49
item.description: v1 Listen, islands, to me. Listen, you peoples, from afar: Yahweh has called me from the womb; from the inside of my mother, he has mentioned my name.

item.title: Isaiah 50
item.description: v1 Yahweh says, “Where is the bill of your mother’s divorce, with which I have put her away?

item.title: Isaiah 51
item.description: v1 “Listen to me, you who follow after righteousness, you who seek Yahweh.

item.title: Isaiah 52
item.description: v1 Awake, awake! Put on your strength, Zion. Put on your beautiful garments, Jerusalem, the holy city: for from now on the uncircumcised and the unclean will no more come into you.

item.title: Isaiah 53
item.description: v1 Who has believed our message? To whom has Yahweh’s arm been revealed?

item.title: Isaiah 54
item.description: v1 “Sing, barren, you who didn’t give birth; break out into singing, and cry aloud, you who didn’t travail with child: for more are the children of the desolate than the children of the married wife,” says Yahweh.

item.title: Isaiah 55
item.description: v1 “Hey! Come, everyone who thirsts, to the waters! Come, he who has no money, buy, and eat!

item.title: Isaiah 56
item.description: v1 Yahweh says, “Maintain justice and do what is right, for my salvation is near and my righteousness will soon be revealed.

item.title: Isaiah 57
item.description: v1 The righteous perish, and no one lays it to heart.

item.title: Isaiah 58
item.description: v1 “Cry aloud! Don’t spare! Lift up your voice like a trumpet!

item.title: Isaiah 59
item.description: v1 Behold, Yahweh’s hand is not shortened, that it can’t save; nor his ear dull, that it can’t hear.

item.title: Isaiah 60
item.description: v1 “Arise, shine; for your light has come, and Yahweh’s glory has risen on you.

item.title: Isaiah 61
item.description: v1 The Lord Yahweh’s Spirit is on me, because Yahweh has anointed me to preach good news to the humble.

item.title: Isaiah 62
item.description: v1 For Zion’s sake I will not hold my peace, and for Jerusalem’s sake I will not rest, until her righteousness shines out like the dawn, and her salvation like a burning lamp.

item.title: Isaiah 63
item.description: v1 Who is this who comes from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah?

item.title: Isaiah 64
item.description: v1 Oh that you would tear the heavens, that you would come down, that the mountains might quake at your presence.

item.title: Isaiah 65
item.description: v1 “I am inquired of by those who didn’t ask. I am found by those who didn’t seek me.

item.title: Isaiah 66
item.description: v1 Yahweh says, “Heaven is my throne, and the earth is my footstool.
